page.title: 16Easby Village.
page.content: There are twenty one houses in{Easby village including the vicarage. The nineteenth century stables of{Easby {Hall}have been converted into 7 modern cottages by the owner of the hall who is a builder. Opposite the hall, seven modern houses have been built to blend in with other buildings around a courtyard. By the river there are boarding{kennels},where people leave their dogs when they go on holiday. {Easby Abbey}has a lot of tourists each year. Tourists visit{Richmond Castle then come down river to the ruined abbey and the twelfth century church. Money is being raised for roof restoration for the church. At the top of the hill there is an{echoing stone. You stand on the stone and shout. Your voice hits the ruins and echoes back to you. (B.Aspden,S.Carr)
